ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I'd describe the class as one which treats the topic of identity more from an epistemological than an ethical perspective. Depending on the student's interests, I would highly recommend the course to another student.

I would describe the course as an excellent introduction to the field of Personal Identity and would recommend it to a fellow student who did not have much exposure to the area already, as a good way into it. I would also recommend it to fellow students who feel they benefit from courses with greater structure, as that was provided by the weekly responses, mid term paper etc.I would not recommend this course to higher level students who already had a grounding in the basics of personal identity, on the grounds they might be disappointed with the level of discussion sometimes.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
